Balassa Index (or Revealed Comparative Advantage, RCA)

balassa_index.Rd

Balassa Index (or Revealed Comparative Advantage, RCA)

balassa_index(d = NULL, x = NULL, y = NULL, v = NULL, cutoff = 1,
  discrete = TRUE, tbl = TRUE)

Arguments

d

tibble/data.frame in long format or a dense/sparse matrix
x

column with the elements of set X (applies only if d is a tibble/data.frame)
y

column with the elements of set Y (applies only if d is a tibble/data.frame)
v

column with a metric of the relation between the elements of th sets X and Y (applies only if d is a tibble/data.frame)
cutoff

reference value used for discretization (default set to 1)
discrete

when set to TRUE, all the Balassa Index values below the cutoff are converted to zero and zero otherwise (default set to TRUE)
tbl

when set to TRUE, the output will be a tibble instead of a matrix (default set to TRUE)

References

For more information see:

Mariani M, Vidmer A, Medo M, Zhang Y (2015). “Measuring economic complexity of countries and products: which metric to use?” The European Physical Journal B, 88(11), 293. doi: 10.1140/epjb/e2015-60298-7 .

and the references therein.

Examples

balassa_index(
  d = trade_1962, x = "country", y = "product", v = "value"
)
#> # A tibble: 44,435 x 3
#>    country product value
#>    <chr>   <chr>   <dbl>
#>  1 afg     0106        0
#>  2 afg     0405        0
#>  3 afg     0407        0
#>  4 afg     0501        1
#>  5 afg     0504        1
#>  6 afg     0703        0
#>  7 afg     0712        0
#>  8 afg     0714        1
#>  9 afg     0801        1
#> 10 afg     0802        1
#> # … with 44,425 more rows
